exec: pm.test('Has healthy field or ok', function () {
pm.test('Has token and user', () => { pm.expect(res).to.have.property('token'); pm.expect(res).to.have.property('user'); });
pm.test('Has token and user', () => { pm.expect(res).to.have.property('token'); pm.expect(res).to.have.property('user'); });
// Ensure user exists: if this email not registered, tests may fail. Use previously created attendee email.
if (res.user) { pm.environment.set('userId', res.user.id || res.user._id); pm.environment.set('userRole', res.user.role); }

body.raw:
{
  "title": "{{eventTitle}}",
  "description": "A premier event for developers.",
  "date": "{{eventDateIso}}",
  "location": "San Francisco, CA",
  "seats": 150,
  "price": 99.99,
  "category": "conference",
  "tags": ["tech", "javascript"]
}

exec: const res = pm.response.json(); const r = res.rsvp || res; pm.environment.set('rsvpId', r && (r.id || r._id));
// Seed common dynamic variables if not set

description.content: Comprehensive Postman collection for the Event Karo API. Organized by features with environment variables, auth flow, dynamic data, and tests.
Base URL of the backend server (dev).
Convenience var for API base URL.
JWT set by login request (Authorization: Bearer {{authToken}}).
Logged-in user's id (set by login tests).
Event id captured after creating an event.
RSVP id captured after creating an RSVP.
